body.name: Butterfly in Frost
body.description: A Wall Street Journal, USA Today, Washington Post, and Amazon Charts bestseller.From #1 New York Times bestselling phenomenon Sylvia Day comes a hotly anticipated and passionate new love story.Once, I would never have imagined myself here. But I’m settled now. In a place I love, in a home I renovated, spending time with new friends I adore, and working a job that fulfills me. I am reconciling the past and laying the groundwork for the future.Then Garrett Frost moves in next door.He’s obstinate and too bold, a raging force of nature that disrupts the careful order of my life. I recognize the ghosts that haunt him, the torment driving him. Garrett would be risky in any form, but wounded, he’s far more dangerous. I fear I’m too fragile for the storm raging inside him, too delicate to withstand the pain that buffets him. But he’s too determined…and too tempting.And sometimes hope soars above even the iciest desolation.Emotional and heartrending, Butterfly in Frost marks a brilliant return by global sensation Sylvia Day, the #1 international multimillion bestselling author of the Crossfire saga.

productInformation.value: #4,850 in Kindle Store (See Top 100 in Kindle Store) #20 in Mystery & Suspense (Kindle Store) #46 in Billionaires & Millionaires Romance #82 in Contemporary

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 13, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Not at all what I was expecting.
reviews.reviewText: When I first starting reading this, I was thinking the same storyline as I’ve read in some of Sylvia’s other books. But the more I read, the more I began seeing the true story unfold before my very eyes! I was still surprised at the end! If you haven’t read this one, do read it! You won’t be disappointed.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 6, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars I didn’t see that coming…
reviews.reviewText: Damn. That ending knocked me back. I had to go back and read the part at the fountain again because I thought she was having an episode, since her grief and depression hadn’t been addressed. I’m the beginning I thought Garrett’s coming over and jumping at her was too much like Gideon and Eva, but now knowing the back story it has a whole other new take on how everything progressed and it didn’t seem as rushed. Why Garrett didn’t want to leave and go to the exhibit in New York without Teagan made so much more sense at the end when he said she was the most important thing in his life and he didn’t want to mess it up this time. I thought Garrett was being presumptive when he said they would hang the painting in their bedroom, above their bed when they hadn’t been together all that long. That they both found their way back to each other after losing so much and going through so much pain was so endearing, moving, and heartbreaking. I really appreciated the measure that the author included their struggle with mental health in the book. It was refreshing and it makes makes the reader realize this can effect anyone, it points out the fact that Teagan wasn’t opening up about her grief because she felt she couldn’t. Mental health seems to be swept under the rug and not brought up enough in romance; it was touching the author circled their whole story around it and made it so the story didn’t suffer for it.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 9, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars beautiful story and unexpected plot twist
reviews.reviewText: I loved this book. It seemed to move a little fast in the beginning but it all made sense when other details were revealed. It was a beautiful story and I loved the ending.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 25, 2023
reviews.reviewText: I love me some Sylvia Day romance novels and had been waiting a long time to hear from her again when this book came out. But after reading it I wasn't sure if I liked it or not. I think it's partially because I was expecting another love story the one in the Crossfire series. The other reason was that although I can usually sniff out any whodunit's or secret spoilers pretty early on in most books, i really didn't get what was happening until the very end. As soon as I finished I read the book all the way through again to look for clues that I missed the first time. Anyway, although it's no Crossfire, I decided I did enjoy it. And I'm determined that in the future I'll try to be more open minded. It's not fair for me to expect every book that an author writes to be a carbon copy of their last one.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 14, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Love an unexpected ending
reviews.reviewText: Just a wonderful fun and engrossing read! Totally suprised by the ending!! I'm hoping there is a sequel to this love story!!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 13, 2023
reviews.reviewText: I wasn't sure about the book at v as I kept reading I enjoyed the characters and their own unique situations. The author could have delved into certain themes a little bit more, but overall it was very interesting and not a typical romance.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 12, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars a real twister
reviews.reviewText: Loved the book. Ending was a surprise that I never guessed. The characters were very real and enjoyed them meeting

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 29, 2023
reviews.reviewText: There is zero character development, it’s hello, I love you, the end. There’s a twist at the end that I feel like is kind of hinted here and there but even knowing this, it just comes out of left field because we hardly know anything about these characters. I think she wanted the twist to really be a shock but by doing this she didn’t write anything or value leading up to it.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on January 11, 2024
reviews.reviewText: A beautiful story, of love, loss and grief.First reading this story, I thought I had missed part of the story, it's not until the end of the book, you realise that actually it all makes sense.A beautifully written book and great audio. Mainly from Teagan's POV, she tells the story of her life when she meets Garret, the new neighbour next door.It's not a long book, and of course, I'd d for it to be longer, learned more.

Sylvia Day no decepciona.En su línea, un libro entretenido. Es la primera vez que leo a esta autora en inglés, al principio me costó un poco pero ya voy de forma fluida y es muy fácil de seguir, y de emocionarse con los personajes.Sin duda volveré a repetir con esta autora en versión original.

4.5 stars. I agree with some of the other reviewers comments that the ending felt a little rushed. I love the twist and conclusion but wish there was more detail before the end. I guess one could argue that the story is a beginning and the details of the past aren't really important. I appreciate the focus of moving forward. Maybe I just wasn't ready to let go of Garrett and Teagan. I loved the story and the characters.
I really enjoyed reading it! It is always awesome to read about survivors and fierce people!
What can I say about Sylvia's book ? All of them are consistent and very well written. The characters are humans like us and theirs stories rich in every step. I Love this book as well
